rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative directly modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment uses neutral language ('behave strangely or aggressively') to describe symptoms.
The segment reports on animal behaviour.
The segment does not contain a loaded rhetorical question.
The segment reports a negative fact (animal behavior) without explicit calming language.
No minimiser or scale contrast found.
The segment does not contain a bare negation.
The segment describes symptoms/behavior of infected animals, not capabilities or preparedness.
The segment does not primarily report prices, economic data, or numerical metrics.
The segment describes symptom/behavior, not speculation about future relief.
No direct quote or clearly attributed statement providing a dominant frame.
Factual description of symptoms/behaviour in animals.
